Articles.Content:
So I've been watching Scott Manley's youtube channel as well as HOCGamings Career mode video series for tips and tricks with KSP but there's something i'm confused about.

in HOCGamings moon landing videos he builds his final stage with a pod, 1 x FLT400 fuel tank and an engine, he then tacks two smaller fuel tanks onto the side of the 400 tank. During the mission he shifts fuel from the two side-tanks into the main tank to allow him to keep going, I tried this during my most recent mun landing attempt and couldn't get it to work so I just looped the mun and came back home.

How can I transfer fuel from these 'backup' tanks, to the main tank?

all I see when I right-click on the tanks is a "Play" icon next to the fuel amount and if I click it it switches to a "Stop" icon.

any help is greatly appreciated!

Edited January 3, 2014 by DelayedReaction

Right click tank 1, hold alt and right click tank 2.

You can thank me later.

Right click tank 1, hold alt and right click tank 2.

You can thank me later.

I will check that out when I get home but i'll give a pre-emptive thanks now

I would suggest using fuel pipes for that purpose. They will tell the engine to pull fuel from these side tanks first, and only when they're empty to pull fuel from the main tank. You can also put those two tanks on decouplers and drop them as soon as they're empty.

Note: I did not see the video so this is my free interpretation of your description.

If you don't have fuel pipes yet then of course you need to transfer fuel manually. You can still have them on decouplers though.

And one more note: when I ran out of easily accessible Kerbin science (within 100 km from KSC) in my Career run I already had fuel pipes.

Edited January 3, 2014 by Kasuha
Remember that it's right-shift on linux, not alt.

Thanks guys, I'm on windows so that's not a problem, and Kasuha, you are correct, I don't have fuel pipes yet although i'm not far off, hoping that my Mun Landing and experiments there will take me to them.
